Dickinson said the decision in the Dobbs case ‚Äî as well as another out of New York earlier in the week expanding gun rights ‚Äî appears to be out of step with public opinion.

Dickinson said he thinks that shows the court is willing to roll back additional privacy rights. In his concurring opinion Friday, Justice Clarence Thomas wrote that the court ‚Äúshould reconsider‚Äù its decisions in other substantive due process rights cases such‚Ä¶
‚ÄúHere, the court has done something unprecedented in that it has eliminated a fundamental right it established 50 years ago,‚Äù he said.

fundamental right.‚Äù

Traditionally, Dickinson said, the Supreme Court has been in the business of expanding and strengthening fundamental rights based on the Constitution.

‚ÄúThis is going to have long-term implications for the public‚Äôs perception of the court and the legitimacy of the court,‚Äù he said.

Learning about what‚Äôs happening in Ukraine at this moment breaks my heart. It‚Äôs sickening. It‚Äôs anti-democratic. It‚Äôs authoritarianism. It‚Äôs an assault on human rights, and an attack on the international community writ large.

Putin has ordered an attack on Ukraine, a democratic sovereign nation, which will result in lives lost, communities destroyed and thousands of refugees seeking safety. This is unprovoked and unjustified. Russia must be held accountable.
